titleStmt.title: An entry from the Journals of Hensley Henson

sourceDesc.bibl: Edited from the manuscripts in the custody of Durham Cathedral Library.

p.hi: I left Hotham in time to catch the early train from Hull, which brought me to Durham about noon. I attended Evensong, and walked with Logic. Then I wrote letters, but was interrupted by Captain Roberts, who came to ask whether I w
"use my influence with the Government" in order to get the local organ–building works used for munitions. I declined to interfere in the matter.
